TopicTitle: Center navball in mk3 cockpit inverted? just me?

Articles.Content:
![yqjMlfK.png](http://i.imgur.com/yqjMlfK.png)

I don't know if somebody else has the same problem, but it seems like the center navball in my mk3 cockpits are inverted. anybody knows how I can fix this?

I don't think I have seen it in other peoples install so I kinda wonder if there are other people with the same bug.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-31T20:10:42Z" title="05/31/2015 08:10  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 31, 2015</time> by Claw**
It happens to me too! Looks like it is a bug. I have posted the bug report on the tracker.

That might explain the horrified look on that kerbal's face.

(updated)

Cheers,

~Claw
Aww c'mon guys, obviously it's for inverted flight ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Did you check if you have any probe in you vessel which happens to have been assembled... inverted. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Does that "glitch" disappears when you right click on your command pod and select "command from here"? Assuming your command is point upwards when on launch pad.

finally, your whole command module ( cockpit) may have been rotated 180 degrees relatively to your ship's " normal" flight plane.

the solution? Get to the SPH and redesign parts rotation ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

looking at it more closely... The other artificial horizon's seem to be ok... It's a glitch! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif))))
